title: Innogy Logo
content:
Hi,   
   
Just a quick ID on the old Innogy logo font, here are a few samples, any ideas?   
   
   
 [http://news.bbc.co.uk/olmedia/1825000/images/\_1825722\_innogy300.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526122040/http:/news.bbc.co.uk/olmedia/1825000/images/_1825722_innogy300.jpg)   
 [http://www.natwindpower.co.uk/goolefields/images/innogy.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526122040/http:/www.natwindpower.co.uk/goolefields/images/innogy.gif)   
 [http://www.gasforum.org/images/comp\_logos/innogy.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526122040/http:/www.gasforum.org/images/comp_logos/innogy.gif)   
 [http://www.linguamatics.com/Images/innogy\_logo.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526122040/http:/www.linguamatics.com/Images/innogy_logo.gif)   
   
A logo is also attached to this message.   
   
Thanks!   
   
James ![Innogy Logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526122040im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/35678.gif)
author: deagio

comments.content:
does no one have any idea what it is?   
   
thnx,   
   
james

I'm with Yves. It looks to me like they started with Helvetica Bold Oblique or Italic, built a new y out of a u, custom-designed the tails, and finally sat something heavy on it to squish it down.   
   
I was surprised to see how few faces feature this kind of y, at least in my search. Sorry, James.
